review: I had such high hopes for the Fire TV Stick, and it has met most of them. We tried several streaming devices in our bedroom before getting the Fire Stick. Our Wi-Fi signal isn't the best in that particular room and the other devices we tried were very intermintent. The Fire Stick has worked the best of any so far. It does occasionally lose the signal (which wouldn't bother me much) but it is a pain to get it back. Sometimes it just magically works again. Other times we've had to unplug it. Yet other times I've had to delete all the wireless settings and start over because it will show the signal with a "very good" connection but just won't connect. It is irritating to go through the process but when the Fire Stick is working, it works really well! We mostly use it for streaming Amazon Prime and Netflix. I hope that more apps will be available in the future that will be useful for us. I love the ability to move it to another room or travel with it. It was well worth the price we paid when it was on special.
author: Edie Carter

review: Great features.... Very poor antenna design.  I have owned this device for several weeks and I continue to lose the network connection every few hours of viewing.  Reviewing the online forums I've found that many other users are experiencing the same thing even though, like myself, their firestick is only a few feet from the network router. All other devices on the network continue to work fine.  To recover from this we have to manually either power off the device or reset it by holding the select and play buttons in for 5 seconds. Some users have also found that taping a 14" length of copper wire from the device has helped (ugly and not always practical).  If/when connected to the network this is a great device.
author: Mike in VT "mikevt1"
